items.sentence: We can\'t afford to make this kind of mistake again.
Not only Tom has to study, but I have to study, too.
People may not even know that they have the disease.
The tetanus shot hurt me more than the dog bite did.
He said he would give me a call, but he hasn\'t yet.
Do you think we shouldn\'t have told Tom about this?
Tom means exactly the opposite of what he\'s saying.
This is the second time Tom has been here this week.
Would it have been better if Tom hadn\'t been there?
Tom plays the guitar better than anyone else I know.
Tom doesn\'t know what Mary wants to eat for dinner.
Tom explained that in French, so I\'d understand it.
I\'ve always known something like this might happen.
I\'ve arranged transportation for us back to Boston.
I\'ve been studying French for the last three years.
I\'ve been trying all week to get in touch with Tom.
I don\'t see anything wrong with what you\'re doing.
Are you positive that you saw me turn the stove off?
You\'re sad now but, with time, you\'ll get over it.
Just tell me what you want and I\'ll give it to you.
I was late for the meeting because of a traffic jam.
I was talking to Tom about what happened last night.
I was the one who convinced Tom to start doing that.
I was the only one other than the driver on the bus.
I\'ve made up my mind to learn how to play the harp.
I need to know why Tom was absent from school today.
I need to warn Tom that there may be a few problems.
I never got around to cleaning out the garage today.
I never thought Tom would come back to Boston again.
I never wanted to leave Boston, but I had no choice.
Tom knows who killed his dog, but he won\'t tell us.
I think Tom is going to do that in Boston next week.
Tom\'s decision to get married surprised his family.
Tom\'s girlfriend is quite a bit younger than he is.
Tom\'s girlfriend is three years younger than he is.
Tom\'s room is at the end of the hall, on the right.
Tom is married, but he doesn\'t wear a wedding ring.
You shouldn\'t talk about people behind their backs.
You\'ll be asleep by the time your father gets home.
Your name wouldn\'t be Tom, by any chance, would it?
Tom has trouble dealing with this kind of situation.
I get the feeling you don\'t really want me to stay.
That doesn\'t smell like something I\'d want to eat.
Everyone just stared at Tom and didn\'t say a thing.
Tom drilled a hole in the wall and hit a water pipe.
Tom has done everything that Mary said he should do.
I suppose Tom told you what time he plans to arrive.
I suspect Tom and Mary are planning to eat together.
I suspect that Tom and Mary were anxious to do that.
I suspect that Tom is unaware of what Mary has done.
Mary and some other women were here for a few hours.
Mary has a pretty smile and is always very friendly.
Mary has been looking for a job since she graduated.
Mary is a nice girl, except that she talks too much.
If you need a dictionary, I can lend you my old one.
Tom\'s barn was struck by lightning twice last year.
Tom\'s design saved the company millions of dollars.
Tom, what\'s wrong? Are you in some kind of trouble?
Tom knew that the dog on the porch belonged to Mary.
Tom knew who Mary thought was going to win the race.
Tom knows better than to believe anything Mary says.
Tom lay awake all night, thinking about the problem.
Tom chose a song from the list and began singing it.
Tom closed the door and he and Mary started kissing.
Tom could hear Mary snoring loudly in the next room.
I suspect Tom didn\'t leave when he was supposed to.
Tom heard Mary cry and wondered what the matter was.
Tom heard a gunshot just as he was opening the door.
Tom hired a local contractor to remodel his kitchen.
There is not much possibility of his coming on time.
There is something else over here I want you to see.
There was absolutely nothing I could do to save Tom.
There were a lot of things Tom said he needed to do.
There were so many things that reminded Tom of Mary.
Tom told Mary and her children an interesting story.
How did Tom know that Mary wasn\'t going to be here?
I think Tom is too young to really understand women.
Tom didn\'t even look at the letter Mary handed him.
Tom didn\'t expect the test to be as easy as it was.
Tom didn\'t have enough time to finish his homework.
I have to go soon because I left the engine running.
Learning French takes longer than most people think.
We\'re thinking about putting our house up for sale.
We\'ve finished the work, so we may as well go home.
Were you the one who told Tom that he shouldn\'t go?
What Tom thinks doesn\'t matter all that much to me.
Tom suspects that Mary and I are plotting something.
Tom warned Mary not to go out by herself after dark.
Tom\'s car isn\'t here, so he must\'ve already left.
Tom already knows why Mary doesn\'t want to do that.
Didn\'t you know Tom and Mary often travel together?
Didn\'t you know Tom was going to Australia with me?
Didn\'t you know that Tom used to live in Australia?
Neither Tom nor Mary knows how to play the clarinet.
Our policy is to build for the future, not the past.
Tom wants Mary to know he\'s planning to leave town.
Tom wants me to call him, but I don\'t think I will.
Tom has been a close friend of mine for a long time.
Tom has been coming here three or four times a week.
Tom has been saving up money so he can go to Boston.
